docs.lead_paragraph: Ann Logan and her three sisters grew up in Delaware; none of them have children. Their stepbrother and seven first cousins on both sides are childless, as well. ''Each of us had different reasons,'' she told me. Ms. Logan, the eldest sister at 63, doesn't regret her decision not to be a parent, but she does worry about the future as she and her relatives all age.

headline.kicker: POSTINGS | RECENT ENTRIES FROM OUR BLOGS

docs.abstract: Paula Span The New Old Age blog provides advice to elderly who are without children to care for them (M)
